Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Deltyn Le Lincoln was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).
  • Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution to victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.
Concurrent with: Ct#2

records.addlTxt: Plea, Sentencing Hearing held on May 13, 2022.
Arraignment held on March 14, 2022
Status Conference held on April 8, 2022
Initial Appearance held on January 11, 2022

ADDRESS INFO for Deltyn Le Lincoln

Prior: W3195 235th Ave, Maiden Rock, WI 54750 United States
Pierce County DNA Proof of Submission

04:33 PM Defendant Deltyn Le Lincoln in court with attorney Kevin Wade DeVore.  Halle E. Hatch appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Victim (MH) appeared via phone. 21CF18 and 22CF4 heard at this. DA Hatch: reinstate the DJOC on 21CF18 for a total of 4 years; new conditions. Amended information filed in 22CF4. guilty to both counts in 22CF4 2 years probation; 14 days jail w/out EHM, immediate report, 66 days jail w/EHM starting May 26. court costs, DNA sample. Atty DeVore and Defendant agree.   Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights form is filed with the court; court reviews with Def.  Court informs Defendant of charges, possible penalties and constitutional rights.  Defendant understands charges, penalties and constitutional rights. Defendant pleas guilty to amended Ct#1 and Ct#2 in 22CF4. Counsel stipulate to factual basis.   Court finds def is making plea knowingly, intelligently and voluntarily and waives constitutional rights. Court finds a factual basis to accept the plea. Court finds Defendant to amended Ct#1 and Ct#2 in 22CF4. DA Hatch gives sentencing on 21CF18 and 22CF4. Court has reviewed the original VIS and uploaded VIS. Atty DeVore gives sentencing agrument. Atty Devore requests a furlough for a few hours for Defendant to appear for an assessment. DA Hatch does not take a position on furlough request. Court reopens the conviction in 21CF18 and withholds entry of conviction in favor of DJOC.  Court approves the request to reinstate the DJOC in 21CF18; court will sign.  Court orders on amended Ct#1 and Ct#2; concurrent - 80 days jail jail served:  14 days jail without EHM, immediate report, 66 days with EHM starting May 26 at 10:00 am, allows a furlough on May 17 at 7:45am and must report back to jail at 11:00 am and must provide his own transportation. Court costs on each count($443), DNA sample, Comply with any programming as recommended by the COMPAS assessment and/or Department of Corrections.  1 day credit if probation is revoked in 22CF4. Appeal rights are given to the defendant. Clerk will provide a copy of the DJOC 4:55

03:24 PM Defendant Deltyn Le Lincoln appears via videoconferencing with Attorney Liesl E. Nelson via phone.  Defendant Deltyn Le Lincoln in custody.  DA Halle E. Hatch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court advises of charges and possible penalties.  Further reading waived.  Constitutional rights explained to defendant.  State requests $10,000 signature bond w/conditions of AS, NPOAOCS w/o VP, NEBTLS.  No objection.  Court orders bond as requested and advises of additional standard conditions.  Court questions Defendant's address, phone and dob.  Non-military.  Court advises of right to speedy preliminary hearing, Defendant requests w/in 20 days.  PD will not be involved.  Court questions Defendant as to representation.  DA Hatch requests Defendant contact Samantha Brill upon release re: 21CF18.  Adjourned at 3:32 PM  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 14, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
